title: Install hyperpixel 4 drivers and setup screen.
description:
HyperPixel 4.0 Implementation Plan for Debian Trixie

Target: octopi.local.frostbyte.us (root, ~/.ssh/octopi_key)
Hardware: HyperPixel 4.0 Touch (800x480)
OS: Debian Trixie (Kernel 6.x+)

CRITICAL CONSTRAINTS:
- Display uses ALL GPIO pins (DPI mode)
- I2C, SPI, UART hardware interfaces MUST be disabled
- Use KMS (Kernel Mode Setting) driver, NOT legacy framebuffer
- All commands are idempotent

PHASE I: DISCOVERY
Locate boot configuration (varies by Debian build):
- Check /boot/firmware/config.txt (standard location)
- Fallback to /boot/config.txt
- Identify kernel version for KMS compatibility

PHASE II: CONFIGURATION
1. Backup existing config.txt
2. Disable conflicting interfaces:
   - dtparam=i2c_arm=off
   - dtparam=spi=off
   - dtparam=i2s=off
3. Enable HyperPixel KMS overlay:
   - dtoverlay=vc4-kms-dpi-hyperpixel4
4. Set console rotation in cmdline.txt:
   - video=DPI-1:800x480@60,rotate=90

PHASE III: VALIDATION
1. Reboot host
2. Wait 60s for boot
3. Check dmesg for "hyperpixel|vc4-kms-dpi"
4. Verify touch: ls /dev/input/event*

TROUBLESHOOTING:
- Black screen: I2C/SPI not disabled (pin conflicts)
- Touch not working: Check /dev/input/event* devices
- Rotation wrong: Adjust rotate=90|180|270|0 in cmdline.txt

SCRIPTS: Available in implementation plan document
